it.polimi.se2019.controller

Class AvailableActions

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.controller.AvailableActions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AvailableActions
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class builds the message object that the ActionManager in controller builds and sends over to the Client to choose from In the Normal 1 combination (move, move, move) you will only use the cell object In the Normal 2 combination (move,(move) grab) you will only use the cell object In the Normal 3 combination ((move), shoot) you will use the cell object and an object for each card in your hand that indicates if you can use it and in which way The client will then build an "answer object" containing his selection
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvailableActions

        public AvailableActions(ActionRequestView macroAction,
                        int playerId,
                        Controller currentController)
        Method that calculates the actions available to a player during a certain turn (after the selection of a macro action)
        Parameters:
        macroAction - player's selection (in ActionRequestView through GUI or CLI)
        playerId - player's number (ID) builds available actions depending on the game status

    • Method Detail

      • buildActions

        private void buildActions(Controller currentController,
                          Player player,
                          ActionRequestView macroAction,
                          int maxMoveDistance,
                          boolean grab,
                          boolean shoot,
                          boolean frenzyReload)
        method that builds the available actions from the macro actions
        Parameters:
        player: - is the subject of the action
        maxMoveDistance: - number of move actions in the macro actions
        grab: - if there is a grab option
        shoot: - if there is a shoot option (sometimes it's the only action possible)
        frenzyReload: - if there's a frenzy action with the possibility to reload a gun before shooting it must be considered when evaluating which cards the player can use returns available actions object to return to the player (CLIENT)
